description_txt: stated on April 23, 2017 in an interview on ABC's This Week:
quote_txt: Treasury Department's inspector general found "there's $4 billion a year in excess payments" going to people that shouldn’t get them. "These are mostly Mexicans."

description_txt: stated on April 11, 2017 in a letter to WFAA-TV in Dallas:
quote_txt: Says Texas House rules authorized by the Texas Constitution supersede the state law permitting anyone to record a public government meeting.

description_txt: stated on March 30, 2017 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: In the federal government, "there’s $16 billion in duplicate programs" that can be cut.

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2017 in the daily White House press briefing:
quote_txt: Trump has "worked with Congress to pass more legislation in his first 100 days than any president since Truman."

description_txt: stated on April 19, 2017 in a radio show:
quote_txt: Says Bernie Sanders "is the most popular politician in America today."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: "Trump wants to deport American Indians to India."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2017 in a White House web page:
quote_txt: Says he created "over 500,000 new jobs -- with a surge in female employment last month."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: The Ninth Circuit has an overturned record "close to 80%."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Trump's Cabinet is more white and more male than any first Cabinet since President Ronald Reagan’s."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2017 in a panel discussion in Berlin, Germany:
quote_txt: "The single-largest expense in  over half of American households is child care."

description_txt: stated on March 23, 2017 in a speech:
quote_txt: "In the first two years and a couple months (as California treasurer), I have saved taxpayers and ratepayers over $5.2 billion."

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2017 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "We're experiencing a net outflow of illegal, undocumented workers from America back to Mexico."

description_txt: stated on April 17, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: Says Eric Trump said, "My father’s tax return is irrelevant because we’re going to cancel taxes for WEALTHY people anyway."

description_txt: stated on April 24, 2017 in an interview wth the Associated Press:
quote_txt: "Back when they did NATO, there was no such thing as terrorism."

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2017 in an interview with the Associated Press:
quote_txt: Illegal immigration on the U.S.-Mexico border is "the lowest in 17 years."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2017 in an op-ed:
quote_txt: "More than 260,000 Americans are employed by the domestic solar industry — three times as many workers as employed by the entire coal mining industry."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2017 in posts on social media:
quote_txt: "After prohibition ended, police deaths didn't reach 200 a year again until the year Nixon declared war on drugs."

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2017 in a Senate hearing for Rex Tillerson’s nomination for U.S. Secretary of State:
quote_txt: "Nobody applies to the United States for refugee status. They apply to the United Nations."

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2017 in a speech in Youngsville, NC:
quote_txt: "The pace of missile development between (Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un) has increased the testing about twenty-fold."

description_txt: stated on April 18, 2017 in a speech in Kenosha, Wis.:
quote_txt: "No administration has accomplished more in the first 90 days."

description_txt: stated on April 23, 2017 in a segment on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "They voted for (a border wall) in 2006. Then-Senator Obama voted for it. Sen. Schumer voted for it. Sen. Clinton voted for it."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2017 in an article on KMAland.com:
quote_txt: "Missouri is actually the only state that has been forced to borrow money from the federal government to pay for unemployment benefits during each of the last five economic downturns."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2017 in an ad aired on radio and television:
quote_txt: The conservative proposal to replace the Affordable Care Act "lowers premiums by giving New York the freedom to end Obamacare’s costly and ridiculous rules."

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Hate speech is not protected by the first amendment."

description_txt: stated on April 14, 2017 in Internet posts:
quote_txt: "Fox News Sandra Smith: ‘Everybody could see from the United Airlines passenger’s behavior that he was not a genuine American.’ "

description_txt: stated on April 20, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "Trump looking to open up E Coast & new areas for offshore oil drilling when Congress has passed no new safety standards since BP"

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2016 in an Internet post:
quote_txt: "Trump on revamping the military: We’re bringing back the draft."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says President Donald Trump as a candidate mentioned WikiLeaks "over 160 times in speeches" in the last month of the campaign.

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2017 in in a press release:
quote_txt: "The Wawa Welcome America festival (features) . . . America's largest free concert."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2017 in a meeting with University of Missouri System Curator nominees:
quote_txt: "We don’t give bonuses in the state of Missouri on any level of government."
